Overview of Provider

Source: vignettes/provider.Rmd
provider.Rmd
library(provider)


NPPES NPI Public Registry API


You’re billing for a healthcare provider and receive a CO-8 denial on a claim and you need to confirm whether or not the correct taxonomy code was entered on the claim. Armed with the provider’s NPI, you can search the NPPES NPI Registry API with the provider_nppes() function:


# Load library
library(provider)

# Query the NPPES API
nppes_ex <- provider_nppes(npi = 1760485387)
#> Error in provider_nppes(npi = 1760485387): could not find function "provider_nppes"


#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'nppes_ex' not found


Unpack the API response with the provider_unpack() function:


nppes_ex <- provider_unpack(nppes_ex)
#> Error in provider_unpack(nppes_ex): could not find function "provider_unpack"


Giving you the results in tibble form:


nppes_ex |> 
  tidyr::nest(identifiers = c(ident_code, 
                              ident_desc, 
                              ident_issuer, 
                              identifier, 
                              ident_state),
              taxonomies = c(taxon_code, 
                             taxonomy_group, 
                             taxon_desc, 
                             taxon_state, 
                             taxon_license, 
                             taxon_primary),
              addresses = c(country_code, 
                            address_purpose, 
                            address_1, 
                            city, 
                            state, 
                            postal_code, 
                            telephone_number, 
                            fax_number))
#> Error in tidyr::nest(nppes_ex, identifiers = c(ident_code, ident_desc, : object 'nppes_ex' not found


Medicare Fee-For-Service Public Provider Enrollment API


What if you need the provider’s PECOS PAC ID or Enrollment ID? Using the provider_mppe() function, you can search Medicare’s Fee-For-Service Public Provider Enrollment API:


provider_enrollment(npi = 1760485387)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 11
#>   npi    pecos…¹ enrlm…² provi…³ provi…⁴ state…⁵ first…⁶ mdl_n…⁷ last_…⁸ org_n…⁹
#>   <chr>  <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>  
#> 1 17604… 872999… I20100… 14-11   PRACTI… MN      PAUL    ROBERT  DEWEY   ""     
#> # … with 1 more variable: gndr_sw <chr>, and abbreviated variable names
#> #   ¹​pecos_asct_cntl_id, ²​enrlmt_id, ³​provider_type_cd, ⁴​provider_type_desc,
#> #   ⁵​state_cd, ⁶​first_name, ⁷​mdl_name, ⁸​last_name, ⁹​org_name


Medicare Order and Referring API


Is the provider currently eligible to make referrals to Medicare Part B or a Home Health Agency (HHA)? Order Durable Medical Equipment (DME) or Power Mobility Devices (PMDs)? Search Medicare’s Order and Referring API with provider_moar():


order_refer(npi = 1760485387)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 7
#>          npi last_name first_name partb dme   hha   pmd  
#>        <int> <chr>     <chr>      <lgl> <lgl> <lgl> <lgl>
#> 1 1760485387 DEWEY     PAUL       TRUE  TRUE  TRUE  TRUE


Medicare Provider and Supplier Taxonomy Crosswalk API


You may need to find Medicare’s specialty codes for this provider’s taxonomies. Using the output from the NPPES search in the first example, you can search Medicare’s Provider and Supplier Taxonomy Crosswalk API with provider_mpstc():


taxonomy_crosswalk(taxonomy_code = "2086S0102X")
#> # A tibble: 1 × 4
#>   medicare_specialty_code medicare_provider_supplier_type_desc…¹ provi…² provi…³
#>   <chr>                   <chr>                                  <chr>   <chr>  
#> 1 2                       Physician/General Surgery              2086S0… Allopa…
#> # … with abbreviated variable names
#> #   ¹​medicare_provider_supplier_type_description, ²​provider_taxonomy_code,
#> #   ³​provider_taxonomy_description_type_classification_specialization


You can check to see if a provider is due to revalidate their Medicare enrollment by accessing Medicare’s Revalidation Due Date API with provider_mrdd():


revalidation_date(npi = 1760485387)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 14
#>   month      enrollmen…¹ natio…² first…³ last_…⁴ organ…⁵ enrol…⁶ enrol…⁷ provi…⁸
#>   <date>     <chr>       <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>  
#> 1 2022-12-21 I201005050… 176048… Paul    Dewey   ""      MN      3       Non-DM…
#> # … with 5 more variables: enrollment_specialty <chr>,
#> #   revalidation_due_date <chr>, adjusted_due_date <chr>,
#> #   individual_total_reassign_to <chr>, receiving_benefits_reassignment <int>,
#> #   and abbreviated variable names ¹​enrollment_id,
#> #   ²​national_provider_identifier, ³​first_name, ⁴​last_name, ⁵​organization_name,
#> #   ⁶​enrollment_state_code, ⁷​enrollment_type, ⁸​provider_type_text


Providers may need to update their digital contact information in the NPPES system. To check, you can access the CMS Public Reporting of Missing Digital Contact Information API with provider_promdci(). If they appear in the search results, it’s time to update their NPPES contact information:


missing_information(npi = 1760485387)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 3
#>   npi        last_name first_name
#>   <chr>      <chr>     <chr>     
#> 1 1760485387 Dewey     Paul


You can find out if a provider has opted out of Medicare by searching the Medicare Opt Out Affidavits API with provider_mooa():


opt_out(npi = 1114974490)
#> # A tibble: 1 × 14
#>   date       last_updated first_…¹ last_…² npi   speci…³ optou…⁴ optou…⁵ first…⁶
#>   <date>     <chr>        <chr>    <chr>   <chr> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>  
#> 1 2022-12-21 09/15/2022   David    Altchek 1114… Orthop… 07/01/… 07/01/… 535 EA…
#> # … with 5 more variables: second_line_street_address <chr>, city_name <chr>,
#> #   state_code <chr>, zip_code <chr>, eligible_to_order_and_refer <chr>, and
#> #   abbreviated variable names ¹​first_name, ²​last_name, ³​specialty,
#> #   ⁴​optout_effective_date, ⁵​optout_end_date, ⁶​first_line_street_address


Using provider_mpop(), you can access Medicare’s Physician & Other Practitioners - by Provider and Service API:


physician_by_service(npi = 1760485387, year = "2020")
#> # A tibble: 21 × 30
#>    year  rndrn…¹ rndrn…² rndrn…³ rndrn…⁴ rndrn…⁵ rndrn…⁶ rndrn…⁷ rndrn…⁸ rndrn…⁹
#>    <chr> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>  
#>  1 2020  176048… Dewey   Paul    R       M.D.    M       I       4570 C… ""     
#>  2 2020  176048… Dewey   Paul    R       M.D.    M       I       4570 C… ""     
#>  3 2020  176048… Dewey   Paul    R       M.D.    M       I       4570 C… ""     
#>  4 2020  176048… Dewey   Paul    R       M.D.    M       I       4570 C… ""     
#>  5 2020  176048… Dewey   Paul    R       M.D.    M       I       4570 C… ""     
#>  6 2020  176048… Dewey   Paul    R       M.D.    M       I       4570 C… ""     
#>  7 2020  176048… Dewey   Paul    R       M.D.    M       I       4570 C… ""     
#>  8 2020  176048… Dewey   Paul    R       M.D.    M       I       4570 C… ""     
#>  9 2020  176048… Dewey   Paul    R       M.D.    M       I       4570 C… ""     
#> 10 2020  176048… Dewey   Paul    R       M.D.    M       I       4570 C… ""     
#> # … with 11 more rows, 20 more variables: rndrng_prvdr_city <chr>,
#> #   rndrng_prvdr_state_abrvtn <chr>, rndrng_prvdr_state_fips <chr>,
#> #   rndrng_prvdr_zip5 <chr>, rndrng_prvdr_ruca <chr>,
#> #   rndrng_prvdr_ruca_desc <chr>, rndrng_prvdr_cntry <chr>,
#> #   rndrng_prvdr_type <chr>, rndrng_prvdr_mdcr_prtcptg_ind <chr>,
#> #   hcpcs_cd <chr>, hcpcs_desc <chr>, hcpcs_drug_ind <chr>,
#> #   place_of_srvc <chr>, tot_benes <int>, tot_srvcs <int>, …


This API contains data going back to 2013, so you can perform a long-term analysis of a provider’s Medicare data:


purrr::map_dfr(as.character(2013:2020), ~physician_by_service(npi = 1003000126, year = .x)) |> 
  dplyr::group_by(hcpcs_cd, hcpcs_desc) |> 
  dplyr::summarise(
    Benefits = sum(tot_benes),
    Services = sum(tot_srvcs),
    Avg_Billed = janitor::round_half_up(mean(avg_sbmtd_chrg), digits = 2),
    Avg_Allowed = janitor::round_half_up(mean(avg_mdcr_alowd_amt), digits = 2),
    Avg_Payment = janitor::round_half_up(mean(avg_mdcr_pymt_amt), digits = 2)) |> 
  dplyr::ungroup() |> 
  dplyr::rename(HCPCS = hcpcs_cd, 
                "HCPCS Description" = hcpcs_desc,
                "Avg Charge" = Avg_Billed,
                "Avg Allowed" = Avg_Allowed,
                "Avg Payment" = Avg_Payment) |> 
  dplyr::arrange(dplyr::desc(Services)) |> 
  knitr::kable()
HCPCS HCPCS Description Benefits Services Avg Charge Avg Allowed Avg Payment
